definitions.definition: to the same degree; in the same or in a similar way

examples.text: This job could be done **equally well** by a computer.
The findings of the survey **apply equally to** adults and children.
The birds are equally at home in a woodland or riverside environment.
She may have arrived late or it is equally possible that she never went there at all.
The money was **divided equally** among her four children.

definitions.definition: used to introduce another phrase or idea that adds to and is as important as what you have just said

examples.text: I'm trying to do what is best, but equally I've got to consider the cost.
